titlestmt.titleproper: Manchester, Vt. First Congregational Church records, 1804-1867.
titlestmt.author: Susan Stanley, Zachary Bodnar

seriesstmt.p: This collection is a part of New England's Hidden Histories. Digital historical representations of the collection can be viewed online.

conventiondeclaration.citation: Describing Archives: A Content Standard, Second Edition

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday July 12, 2019 at 18:29
Additional description added, additional subject and agent links added, minor textual revisions incorporated.

did.unittitle: Manchester, Vt. First Congregational Church records, 1804-1867.
did.abstract: The First Congregational Church in Manchester Vermont was first organized in 1784 with Rev. Job Swift as the first minister. Three meeting houses have been constructed by the church, the first in 1779, the second in 1829, and the third in 1862. This collection contains the early administrative records of the church which include meeting minutes, vital records, and church governance records.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this digital collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

Digital Reproductions are protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use the Digital Reproductions in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. In addition, no permission is required from the Congregational Library & Archives for educational uses. For other uses, you need to obtain permission from the Congregational Library & Archives. For additional information regarding copyright, please consult the Congregational Library & Archives' Digital Collections Copyright & Use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Manchester, Vt. First Congregational Church records, 1804-1867, RG5359. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were temporarily loaned to the Congregational Library and Archives, November 2017, by Anne Ehret of the First Congregational Church in Manchester, Vt for the purpose of digitization. Materials were returned following digitization; Accession 2017-16.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: The physical volumes are currently held by the First Congregational Church in Manchester Vermont.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Additional accruals are expected for this collection in the form of full-text transcription. There is no anticipated date for this accrual.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Susan Stanley, April 2018, using DACS Second Edition. Additional description by Zachary Bodnar, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The First Congregational Church in Manchester Vermont was first organized in 1784 with seven founding members. Rev. Job Swift was ordained the first minister and in 1779 the first meeting house was constructed. In 1818, the Rev. Lemual Haynes, who was of African descent, was ordained the seventh minister of the church. The first meeting house was razed in 1829 and the second constructed by the Fall of that year. A parsonage was built in 1862. The third, and last, meeting house was constructed 1871. In 1925 the church interior was renovated and in 1929 an organ was installed along with choir pews. In 1960 a new three-manual organ was installed. The First Congregational Church continues to serve the Manchester community today.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains two volumes of church records dating from 1804-1867. The collection includes meeting minutes, records of votes, baptismal records, membership lists, records of deaths, annual reports, and church governance records.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Records have been arranged chronologically by start date.

phystech.head: Technical Requirements
phystech.p: To access digital user's copies via online-interface, a java-enabled web browser is required. Internet Explorer 8.x and later, Firefox 5.x and later, Opera 12 and later, Safari 5.x and later, or any version of Google Chrome are recommended.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: History of the First Congregational Church of Manchester, Vermont 1784-1959. Manchester, Vt, 1959. (CLA call number: 17.11.1 M 31.59C h)

subject.part: Church records and registers -- Vermont -- Manchester.

altformavail.head: Digital Copies
altformavail.p: These church records were digitized as part of the New England's Hidden Histories project. Digital reproductions are available to view online.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This volume of church records contains the church covenant and confession of faith, lists of members, baptismal records, records of deaths, meeting minutes, and records of votes.

altformavail.head: Digital Copies
altformavail.p: These church records were digitized as part of the New England's Hidden Histories project. Digital reproductions are available to view online.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This volume of church records contains meeting minutes, annual reports, records of votes, notices of baptism, dismission, and admission, as well as a list of members with dates of admission, death, dismissal, and excommunication. The volume also contains a copy of the church covenant, confession of faith, and by-laws.
